summary: "Cats" is a popular musical with songs by Andrew Lloyd Webber, inspired by T.S. Eliot's poems about cats. It's about a group of cats called the Jellicles who choose one cat to get a new life. First performed in 1981, it's one of the longest-running shows on Broadway and in London's West End. Despite mixed reviews, it's been a huge success, earning lots of awards and money. It's been performed worldwide in many languages and made into two films. "Cats" changed how musicals are made and marketed, focusing more on big, family-friendly shows.
title: Cats (musical)
